Reviews.Title: “relatively low price, good location, good service”
Reviews.Author: ali-amini-fard
Reviews.Content: if you look for a 3* hotel in Dubai, i can assure you that Dream Palace is far better than almost all of the other 3*s ( i have stayed at 7 other 3* hotels near Rigga st. during last 5 years). contrary to most of the hotels in Deira district , Dream Palace building is not old, so it is cleaner, it is more comfortable, the rooms are rather spacious and room furniture is new. food quality ( breakfast & lunch ) is good. there are free mini-bus services to beach and many shopping malls. good Arabian restaurants are across the street and many fast foods and cafes are 500 meters away on Rigga st.. it is a 2 minute walk to Reef Mall and metro station and 3 minutes to Al Ghurair city ( mall & cinema ) the ONLY drawback is a near-by mosque whose loud voice might bother you 5 times a day for 30 seconds up to a couple of minutes ( this problem is specially noticeable in early morning an not in the rest of day ) but i am definitely going to stay only at Dream Palace whenever in Dubai

Reviews.Title: “Just acceptable”
Reviews.Author: Rejsende5487478
Reviews.Content: The rooms were clean and of acceptable size. The gym was very small and had broken machines, and the pool small as well. The front desk staff was very rude, but the other staff friendly. There is a mosque in front of it, that makes so much noise you will wake up 5.30 every morning.

Reviews.Title: “How about Nightmare Palace”
Reviews.Author: LalehD
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin from? This was the worst hotel I've ever stayed in. The rating system in Dubai must be totally different. By American (and European) standards this was at best 0.5 star. I'll name a few issues: - Non of the outlets in the room worked, except for one but we still had to play with the cables to make the connection work. - We couldn't get the bathroom door to close except by kicking it really hard. - A couple of days, the house cleaning gave us only one towel and on one day none. 5 phone calls and 1.5 days later, we got the towel. - The fridge barely worked. When put on Max, the temperature would probably get 5 degrees cooler than the room temp. - The TV was completely broken. - The phone barely worked. You had to keep your head still in one position. - So much noise in the middle of the night. Airplanes, and oh my goodness - stray cats, ... - Breakfast was okay considering how awful the hotel was. I did see a cockroach in the bowl of sugar packets though. - The hallways smelled nasty. - The staff was friendly but incompetent for the most part. So unless you're dirt poor, you would be tortured if you stayed in this place.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended....that's what all I need”
Reviews.Author: FreedomAndJustice
Reviews.Content: After i stay in this hotel just one night, i have in my mind all the time that i will make a review on tripadvisor. I would like to recommend Dream palace hotel , UAE (Deira) for the following reason - quite budget, compared with other brand new / chain hotel - location is good, near MRT, not far from Airport by Taxi (40 Dh , actually it might just 20 Dir but taxi from airport will charge 20 Dh extra) - free shuttle bus (return to Airport) , really it's free (see the timing from the photo) - near Reef Mall , the mall is just behind you can buy anything you want (supermarket & mall) - 250 metre to metro station Salah Al Din (Green line), see the photo that i will post - No disco in this hotel so you can sleep without annoyance Something you may not prefer; - Not allow to check in before 1 pm even 5 minutes, even the room is available, you have to wait until it is 1 pm - The room has no window, i guess because it's country of dessert so they prefer constructing the building like this - Internet was not free This hotel is a bit old from the building but i think they renovate inside, bathroom (shower, hair dryer, bath tube) is very good. Since there are many new hotels in Dubai esp. brand or chain hotel, the price of this hotel is a bit cheaper than others but it's all i need. I did not expect a 5 star service, i just want t good place to sleep , so i don't mind if i will not be called every 5 mins "how are you sir / mam?" (which is a norm of 5 star hotel!) When i search for hotel, i found some cheaper nearby but the hotel has disco in ground floor and many people commented that it's loudly until 3 am, even some say many girl service (prostitutes) available. I am a lady travel alone so i want to avoid such environment. Before i have experience, staying in a hotel that has disco and men always look at women in a bad way.......and if you are in gulf, you will understand the attitude of men toward non-Arab women , which i hate that too much so i find a hotel that without such environment. One thing makes me surprised is the maintenance available at 11 pm. By that time the small shower is broken from the reel, i just called reception and expected that they would just turn off the valve. But he said the maintenance staff is available, and they change it for me within 5 10 minutes (from a call - come to the room - go out to take a new reel and change), very impressive. But if you expect a very new room, trendy design, you con consider other hotel, surely in higher price. Be aware that hotel in Dubai will include more 20 percent from the price show in your booking (10 + 10).

Reviews.Title: “Dream Palace”
Reviews.Author: TimboHertfordshireUK
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Dream Palace from 26th November 2011 to 2nd December 2011. The Hotel is easy enough to get to from the airport and is convenient to Union Metro station and the Salah Al Deen stop next to the Reef Mall (which is five minutes from the hotel) . I stayed in one of the Executive rooms on the top floor and it was good enough for me as an independent traveller who wanted to see the sights of Dubai - it had everything that I needed - a comfy bed and a shower so was good enough as a base. The staff were friendly and helfpul enough but the hotel is definitely no frills. There is a mosque right across the road from the hotel so be prepared for an amplified call to Fajr whilst it is still dark. The hotel is also on the flight path from and to the airport which is fun if you like looking at (and hearing) planes and is on a busy street (Deira city comes alive at night) . The pool was open at the top of the building but is quite small and when I was there it wasn't hot enough really to want to use it. There is a nice Syrian Restaurant across the Road. The best point of the hotel is that it is very convenient to the Metro which gives great access to the main shopping malls and the Burj Khalifa (which was my main reason for visiting). As the price was right I wasn't disappointed and had a good stay.

Reviews.Title: “RED FLAG.”
Reviews.Author: mimi h
Reviews.Content: The most Terrible hotel in Dubi,I have stayed in this hotel for fewdays,most of stuff were very rude and arrogant and they have stolen things from me ,yes please do not ever show up in this hotel or plan to make a reservation .Poor quality with some sort of thieves which are taking items from passengers .Never step in this location my advise.Very dangerous!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Good place to stay for the money”
Reviews.Author: DonnaKronmiller
Reviews.Content: It is an older hotel but clean and in a good neighborhood. It is close to several malls including the Reef Mall and several restaurants and grocery stores.

Reviews.Title: “enjoyable stay”
Reviews.Author: happytravellers2011
Reviews.Content: Dream Palce Hotel is located in the old or traditional part of Dubai so don't expect beaches and ocean on your doorstep! But if you are looking for a more authentic Dubai stay in a convenient location at good price, then the Dream Palace is a very good option. I've stayed twice in work mode and found it clean and comfortable. The restaurants closeby were a highlight of the stay, traditional local food at it's best! Closeby also our malls and supermarkets etc. For transport, you are a short walk from the metro stations and taxis in Dubai are affordable.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable stay!”
Reviews.Author: ajacks2003
Reviews.Content: Well first off, for the record I had a wonderful experience during my stay at the Dream Palace. The room I slept in was very comfortable and quiet, with a nice flat screen TV which I enjoyed daily. I also utilized the internet service (for AED 10.00hr) that mantained a great connection, and the price was fairly cheap and reasonable. In fact, I often purchased the 24hr service for AED 60.00. What I liked best, was the customer service. Everyone, always greeted me with a friendly smile and was more than happy to assist me with anything I may have requested. And I found the food at both resturants to be simply remarkable. The only complaints I may have is with the in room refrigerator ( not cool enough), and the fact that there are no in room microwaves but i assure you the staff will definetly assist you.

Reviews.Title: “The worst imaginable hotel in Dubai”
Reviews.Author: FrogtheTraveler
Reviews.Content: First, I am a seasoned traveler whose motto is: "If you want the comforts of home, stay home." Normally, I do not complain about a hotel, but the Dream Palace was an ugly experience. The hotel pictures are misleading. There is nothing to it but a lobby and place to eat. I am a professional who needed Internet. I paid around $17USD per day for Internet but had low to no connectivity in my room. The staff repeatedly told me to take my laptop to the front desk (because there was more connectivity on the ground floor) and would never send anyone to check the connectivity in my room. The Internet in my room never worked, and I ran through at least 15 passwords. Even if the Internet had worked, the continual need to obtain new passwords would have been maddening. The staff became hostile about the Internet issue and said that, if I did not pay for the Internet, the cost of it would be deducted from their paychecks. I finally gave up on the Internet altogether and was still charged for it. I had no hot water for two days. After several requests, the staff turned on the hot water by removing a ceiling panel in the bathroom. The panel was never replaced, leaving a 2' by 2' hole in the ceiling above the bath tub. Anything could have fallen on me. No one ever replaced the panel. The bathroom grout was moldy. The bathtub was so small that no one could sit in it. The television image was pink, wavy and blotchy. The beds and pillows were unbearably hard. I could not sleep well at all. One of my breakfasts was quite good, and the rest were so-so. Most of all, I could not tolerate the rude staff and lack of Internet. If you should baseline self-respect, the Nightmare Palace Hotel is for you.

Reviews.Title: “Clean budget hotel near the airport”
Reviews.Author: GulfTraveller80
Reviews.Content: Good value for money: 50 eur/night with taxes included. We stayed for one night and got upgraded to a suite with a separate living room, which included a decently-sized LCD TV with a good selection of channels. The bedroom had a smaller TV. In general, the room was clean and the furniture, bed linen and towels rather new and in good condition. The Internet was rather reasonably priced (10 Dh/h) although incredibly slow (below the UAE standard) and did not allow downloads/pop-ups. A good location for passers-by: the Al Rigga metro station is just a 10 min walk away and the airport 10-15 min by taxi. However, as women travelling alone might have to bear the occasional but always as disturbing "where are you from" in the elevator, staying on the Bur Dubai side might be recommedable.

Reviews.Title: “OK for a night but not longer”
Reviews.Author: sheddie70
Reviews.Content: Hotel is located on a main road in Deira about 10 mins walk fro mthe nearest undergraoud station (al rigga) which is about 4 stops from the airport. The hotel advertises a free airport shuttle which was what attracted me to this hotel as I has an early morning flight. However, it seems that the shuttle doesn't start running until about 9:30 which was therefore not uch use to me. It's a reasonabel deal if you have a late-night arrival or early mornig departure as it is within 5 mins taxi ride of the airport. However, for longer term stays there a better, cleaner and more convenient hotels. Staff are friendly enough but the rooms are a bit tired-looking.

Reviews.Title: “Very basic and not very convenient, not very helpful”
Reviews.Author: rendezvous3
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night. It is not very convenient hotel for a single lady. Far from many places for tourists. Many good hotels were a better location , better value, with convenient transportation.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay for stopover for 2-3 days...”
Reviews.Author: akoundal
Reviews.Content: if you are staying in dubai for 2-3 days and most of the time will be doing the sighting seeing, then there is no need to pay some hefty hotel charges as you wont be using it facilities :). We recentely travelled to dubai for 2 nights and 3 days so wanted some economical play to stay which was clean and accessible to metro. We chose dream palace hotel after reading the reviews and one of friend also stayed here .Its around 10minutes from the airport from taxi. The meter start from 25D and top it off with 10D. So its not that bad of a deal. If you dont have big luggage, you can travel from Metro, which starts from Airport and drop you off @ Al-Rigga metro, which is 10 minute walk from the hotel. The hotel is nice and clean. The staff is fine and our check in time was hardly 5 minutes. The luggage service to the room is free, but you can tip the person if you want. The rooms are of decent size and clean. The restroom looks updated with all new fixtures, somehow as we were on the top most floor, sometimes the water pressure was not that great.As like any other dubai place, the wi-fi is 10D/hr. There is a small cafe inside the hotel, if you dont want to explore the nearby places. There is a reef mall just @ back of the hotel if you want to check it out for some shopping.There is a mosque just outside the hotel and windows are not noise proof so be prepared to start hearing prayers ~430am. Actually this is everywhere in dubai, you can escape whereever you stay. There are many eating and grocery stores nearby. Our room has fridge so you can bring food and save it for the later day. Best time to visit dubai is from Nov-March, as its cooler.In all if you want some budget place to stay this is not a bad choice, but if you are expecting high touch experience this is not the place :)

Reviews.Title: “everything ok”
Reviews.Author: vanillacream
Reviews.Content: good service price reasonable difficult to find if by airport bus near supermarkets and bus stops (not recommand take bus in dubai, rent a car!!! outside too hot!!!)

Reviews.Title: “Nice and clean hotel”
Reviews.Author: iwanaseetheworld
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Dream Palace for 2 nights. The room was a bit small but sufficient for me. It was very clean and had all the basic amenities. The front desk staff lets you keep your baggage with them after check-out which I found very useful as my flight was late in the night and I could spend the day in the city with the bags. Staff was very friendly and always willing to help. I will consider staying there again..

Reviews.Title: “Lovely place”
Reviews.Author: Afrobabe
Reviews.Content: Stayed in 2 hotels in Dubai and Dream Palace was the best. Friendly and helpful staff. Perfect executive (no visitors allowed though) Swimming-pool on roof but had very dirty water and there was no life guard though hardly neccesary as only 3.5 feet deep....The roof is a bit scarey as the railings are low. Good WiFi-connection (10 D per hour) The area is really safe and getting taxis really easy. " shopping malls within walking distance... Overall...Great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “GOOD HOTEL WITH FRIENDLY STAFFS”
Reviews.Author: Forough
Reviews.Content: GOOD HOTEL , near to many shopping center , nice area ,

Reviews.Title: “never again”
Reviews.Author: babakjoon
Reviews.Content: i will never stay at this hotel again because of dirty rooms including bathroom bad breackfast and launch very bad air condition system no transfer from airport and no transfer to the airport simply the recieption said that the tire of the bus is punched and you should go to the airport by yourself .no guest is allowed at rooms my friend sat about 30 minutes in lobby for me to change my cloths to go out and......this is half of bad things that you can find in this hotel.never never choose this one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent stay, but would be better if metro was even closer”
Reviews.Author: woozie3
Reviews.Content: We had a great 2 night stay at Dream Palace Hotel. Our first taxi driver had trouble finding it, taking us to Dreamland Hotel at first, but subsequent drivers didn't have the same problem. Our arrival and departure, bellboys help you carry your luggage, which is a nice touch. Check-in maybe took longer than it should as I had to fill in and sign a form, eventhough I'd prepaid and organized everything through hotelclub.net. Reception personnel are respectful, but maybe not the most approachable or talkative. In our room, the bellboy started the air- conditioner for us and turned on the TV and set it to an English channel- nice service! The room itself looked freshly renovated and modern, with a nice sized LCD TV. Everything worked well and beds were soft, clean and comfortable. No issues with the bathroom either, which had free soap, shampoo etc. As mentioned elsewhere- morning prayers did wake us up on the 2nd night and seemed to go on quite awhile, but this is nothing to get upset about. More annoying was loud talking and laughing coming from a nearby room, from a group of young men- but this was on one occasion, shortly before we left. For our other 5 nights in Dubai later on, we chose a different hotel- not because Dream Palace wasn't great, but because the other place was a similar price and a short straight walk to the metro. We found that this made a big difference and saved us some money.

Reviews.Title: “Exactly what I wanted”
Reviews.Author: absbos
Reviews.Content: Top value says it all, taxes etc. were an additional 20%, But still only about $75/night with booking.com. I was on the first floor for 1night in room 119, small back corner room, but quiet. But, then was moved the 514 b/c of a minor problem with 119. My lights all turned on twice in the night.... it was some electrical glitch, but it didn't help with jet lag. 514 was bigger and just as clean and almost plush. Comfy bed, great shower, nice tv, and hot pot and fridge in the room. Pool was small and a bit dusty... but I still enjoyed my dip to recharge on day one. Keep in mind there are over 1000 mosques in Dubai and they pray over loud speakers starting pre-dawn and ending post-dusk. I think you would be woken up by this at any hotel in the city, but good to be prepared. By the third night, I almost slept through it. Internet is 10 Dhm for one hour, 2.70 USD and I am pretty sure you can't break your hour into segments. I got to know the metro and city buses quite well. Al Rigga Metro is a 5-8 minute walk and Union Station is about 15 minutes... brisk, but not far at all. The bus routes are nearby too. The Reef mall is directly behind the hotel and has a grocery store... among everything else. The treadmill did appear to be broken, but when will I learn that hoofing it around a city gives me enough exercise? This is a real 3 star hotel and "real" people stay here. It's not Gucci and Courture, thank goodness. Don't stay here for the pool and fitness center. Stay here for the experience of staying in Dubai and being surrounded by local flavor.

Reviews.Title: “Ignore the price or star rating, this hotel should be 4 star and higher priced!”
Reviews.Author: jcerovac
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a lot of hotels in Dubai, including a few of the four star and five star "deluxe, hotel apartment" style hotels. While I've never really been unimpressed, I will say that for a three-star hotel, I have been very please and happy with the Dream Palace. There are plenty of preminum hotels, and Dream Palace is more no-frills, but it is very clean, quiet, and the staff are pretty good. When considering the value, I have to say that dollar-for-dollar, or whatever currency you choose, you will be pleased with this discount, budget hotel. I will most certainly stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: DublinCityCruiser
Reviews.Content: Please understand that this is not a luxury experience. If you want that, find a 5 star hotel. This hotel is 2 star at best, but they do offer clean rooms and good value. Location is not the best as Diera is crowded and noisy, but we had no problems getting a taxi during our 2 day stay. Sites, shopping and restaurants are in easy walking distance. The hotel breakfast buffet is an extra 25 AED (just less than $7) per person and is average. Service throughout the hotel is slow and a little disorganized, but the bill was accurate. The real reason to stay here is the low cost, which is refreshing given Dubai's expensive hotel market.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value for the price”
Reviews.Author: Steve4p
Reviews.Content: Spent 3 nights at the Dream Palace at the end of January 2010. Stayed in a smallish room on the 7th (top) floor. This was fine with me as I only need it for sleep. Air con excellent.. Room must have been recently renovated. Clean linen. Has a smallish TV with 3 or 4 English channels including CNN. Staff friendly. I would stay here again at the excellent rate of $68 per night including all taxes. Used the Metro from Al Riga station, which is about a 10 minute walk from the hotel. Booked it with Expedia.

Reviews.Title: “Clean & Comfortable Room”
Reviews.Author: Rauli-tx
Reviews.Content: I spent one night in the hotel. The hotel seems to have recently renovated. The room was simple: nice and clean, with a small flat screen TV. The AC was very strong. The breakfast buffet was nothing fancy, just decent. The staff was friendly and helped us with directions. The hotel is not centrally located in the Deira District, but it's a 10-minute walk from the new Metro. There are a couple of restaurants across the hotel. Overall, a very good deal

Reviews.Title: “Loved the service and cleanliness of room”
Reviews.Author: anujagarwal
Reviews.Content: An oasis of calm in the midst of chaotic Dubai We stayed here for a night before going on safariwhen it seemed lovely but on staying here again it really came into its own, luxurious feel, wonderful inclusive breakfast, staff who were so friendly and couldn't do enough for you, nothing was too much trouble, would definitely recommend. room service was awesome and at the price it is a steal. has a very small swimming pool but again cant ask for more. located in deira. a good walk from creek to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Sucks”
Reviews.Author: Obaji
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for one night for stop over in Dubai. Somebody knocked the door at 3 am in the morning. I was sleeping and made me scared. Obviousely i ignored this but I dont feel safe to stay here especially for lady travellers. Please be careful and dont open the door. Horrible.

Reviews.Title: “Recently rennovated, best location”
Reviews.Author: YPAL
Reviews.Content: Date : 25.11.2009 We have just returned from a 5 days stay at the Dream Palace Hotel. The hotel is magnificent with fresh interiors, nice and clean bed linens, towels etc. & very good bathrooms. We stayed on 5th Floor in Deluxe double room, which has different scheme from other floors. We were just expecting a few nibbles but breakfast is a lovely continental spread with cheeses fruits, cakes, Arab breads etc. The location of the hotel is in Deira Dubai, which is old Dubai. Right around the hotel there are two good Malls, many super stores, good restaurants only 3-5 minutes walking distance. Gold Souk is also quite near, 10-15 minutes by taxi ( there is always traffic Jam when you go towards that area) There is nearby metro station on Al Rigga road from where you have options to go to new Dubai, Mall of emirates, Airport by paying merely 6-9 dirham. The hotel staff is very co-operative and courtious. I needed an adopter for my camera charger, which was arranged within a short time. My return flight back was scheduled at 22:40,but hotel people allowed me to stay in the hotel upto 18:00 without any extra charges. However the hotel transport from and to airport was through an old bus without curtain, which posed a problem during day time when the sun was at its peak on our way from airport to hotel. Since the distance of airport from the hotel is not much, the hotel could have arranged a car. Overall I would say this is probably the best hotel in 3 star category we have ever stayed in on holiday. YASHPAL NEW DELHI INDIA

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Cosy”
Reviews.Author: Axfunda
Reviews.Content: Dream palace hotel was really nice and cosy place to stay, i did my booking online through www.booking.com and got a single room for great price exclusive of taxes but if u compare dubai, that tax money was peanut. Its located in good area with great food joints around, i did not try the hotel restaurants. I reached dubai on 31st oct, took metro from terminal 3 to AL-RIGGA station, n just walked to the hotel (around 10 mins)(u can ask people for direction to AL-MURAQBAT road. Host at reception was nice and helpful (dont expect it to be a 7 seven hotel). Room was small but cosy and very clean. No free internet (10dhs for an hour), but managed somehow, rest all mery mery, n good, Over all i can give it 7.5 of 10

Reviews.Title: “Good value”
Reviews.Author: Zapphire
Reviews.Content: Paid less than USD300 for 6 nights without breakfast. Cleaning service for the room good - - I would press the button "pls. make up room" on the phone panels & it was done when we got back. Towel exchange available as needed. Complimentary bottled water x2 (big) in fridge. TV channels limited & some channel had unclear reception. I had to pay for internet service. Shower stall too small. Front desk upon check in was good but the staff on check out needed to brush on her people skills. This is a clean & comfortable enough hotel to stay in so I would come back again at the same price or lower.

Reviews.Title: “WOULD CERTAINLY GO BACK AGAIN”
Reviews.Author: JernejS
Reviews.Content: Sweet, nice hotel, good location, nice, friendly people. Roms are small but modern, with all you need. Just a tip-if you like to watch tv at the evening like me - Of the english talking TV channels is only CNN, i have had my lap top with me to watch movies. Internet is dificult to use, there was something wrong with the modem or the conection, it simply didn't conect.

Reviews.Title: “A inexpensive Palace”
Reviews.Author: Travelguy365
Reviews.Content: Received a recomendation to stay at the Dream Palace from my co-workers. I was very impressed. First, I paid about $40 (w/out breakfast) for the room. The room was clean, modern and with a flat-screen TV. The bathroom was modern with a glass shower and completly updated. The staff even let me use the internet in the lobby for about 10 minutes without an additional payment. A small pool and jacuzzi on the roof. The gym is very basic, but has 1 or 2 treadmills. There is even a sauna...very nice after a long day on the town. I travel through Dubai frequently, sometimes with a company paid hotel (which the Dream Palace is not on their list..it should be). When I have to pay for a hotel, this is definitley the one I would stay at. For $40 a night in Dubai, I can afford the dream in this expensive city!

Reviews.Title: “NOT HAPPY, NOT SAFE”
Reviews.Author: moonIran
Reviews.Content: I Stayed in this Hotel for three nights in the month of JUNE 09, The last night of our stay, some one tried to open the door of our room, where my sister and I were sleeping at 4:00 or 5:00 o'clock in the morning.When I complained to the mannager , he said it could have been the ROOM SERVICE!!!!!!!!!!!. This Hotel is NOT SAFE, I do not know who tried to intrude in to the room where two girls were sleeping in the middle of the night. THIS HOTEL IS NOT SAFE.

Reviews.Title: “Newly renowated, good value for money”
Reviews.Author: superneon
Reviews.Content: The hotel is newly renowated, rooms are nice and quite big. The view isn't spectacular but at all it is a very good offer in resonable price. We didn't have a breakfast and possibly this hotel doesn't offer them. We booked with otel.com what is good site for booking in Dubai as you pay full price and don't have to be worried about additionaly paid 10% local tax. The photos on otel are old as well so the hotel looks much beter tha there. The hotel is in Deira district not that far from center but you have to either take a taxi for about 4-5USD or bus to Deira center, It is not that close to the airport as well (25-30min). Comparing to other hotels in Dubai (and references on tripadvisor) there is no any disco closeby. It is nice and quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent value, better than expected”
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey T
Reviews.Content: We reserved here based on the TripAdvisor reviews, and we were pleasantly surprised. The hotel was recently renovated, so everything is clean and new-looking. We reserved it at the airport's Central Reservation Service, no problem at all. Location is near the Reef Mall. It is not far from the airport as the crow flies, but the roadway design means it is twice as far coming from the airport as going To the airport! Rooftop swimming pool is small, like a bathtub in the incredible summer heat; but still very pleasant and clean. Overall, basic hotel, quite comfortable and quiet, though not a luxury resort. Also note that it is near a couple of good barbers and restaurants!

HotelInfo.Name: Dream Palace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Al Muraqqabat Rd | Deira, Dubai 82777, United Arab Emirates
